title: What is an example of a scientific paper? - Quora

response.answer_text: A link:Whole Genome, Whole Population Sequencing Reveals That Loss of Signaling Networks Is the Major Adaptive Strategy in a Constant Environment A scientific paper is an article, typically of 2-20 pages in length, that is peer reviewed and published in a scientific journal. These journals are either run by various scientific societies (e.g. Science is run by the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS), PNAS is published by the US National Academy of Sciences etc), or by various either non-profit or for-profit enterprises e.g. Nature, published by the Nature Publishing Group, and PLoS Biology, which is published by the nonprofit Public Library of Science group.  Different journals have different amounts of prestige attached to them, based on their publication history, breadth of readership, and diversity of fields that publish in it. Typically, Nature, Cell and Science are considered the top biological journals, with Cell being more specialized in Biology while the others publish from all scientific fields (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering etc.)

Here ya go: Page on jst.go.jp by Kiyoshi Mabuchi, Kensei Tanaka, Daichi Uchijima, Rina Sakai. It's in the journal of the Japanese Society of Tribologists (a branch of mechanical engineering). It just won a significant award.
